head.title: In the Mideast, Time for a Recess; Barak's Olive Branch

hedline.hl1: In the Mideast, Time for a Recess; Barak's Olive Branch

abstract.p: Eric Jay Wolf letter scores failure of Yasir Arafat and Palestinian Authority to make a lasting peace with government of Prime Min Ehud Barak

block.p: Re ''Israel's Deadly Errors,'' by Rami G. Khouri (Op-Ed, Oct. 10):

When history looks back on this latest violence between Israel and the Palestinians, it will realize that it took place under an Israeli government that is certainly the most dovish in the short history of the state.
Re ''Israel's Deadly Errors,'' by Rami G. Khouri (Op-Ed, Oct. 10):

When history looks back on this latest violence between Israel and the Palestinians, it will realize that it took place under an Israeli government that is certainly the most dovish in the short history of the state.

This is a government that time and again has done the unimaginable: from publicly speaking of a Palestinian state to raising the possibility of transferring control of parts of Jerusalem to the Palestinian Authority.

This is a government that truly trusted its partner, only to have that trust crumble with the stones of Joseph's Tomb. If Yasir Arafat and the Palestinian Authority can't make a lasting peace with the Barak government, I shudder to think what they will do with a Sharon government.
ERIC JAY WOLF New York, Oct. 10, 2000
